question: The Curie temperatures of Cobalt and iron are 1400K and 1000 K respectively. At <katex>$T=1600K$</katex>, the ratio of magnetic susceptibility of Cobalt to that of iron is
explanation: According to Curie-Weiss law for ferromagnetic materials above Curie temperature, <katex>$\chi \propto \frac{1}{T - T_c}$</katex>. Ratio <katex>$\frac{\chi_{Co}}{\chi_{Fe}} = \frac{T - (T_c)_{Fe}}{T - (T_c)_{Co}} = \frac{1600 - 1000}{1600 - 1400} = \frac{600}{200} = 3$</katex>.
